intro: Urachne acutigluma, commonly known as the sharp-leaf urachne, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and prefers full sun exposure. Its leaves are lance-shaped and have a slightly hairy texture, while its flowers are small and yellowish in color. It is often found in coastal and inland regions, thriving in arid and semi-arid environments.
